title: `const` and `enum` are mutually exclusive
description: `const` defines one exact value. Adding an `enum` is redundant or contradictory.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Wrong: const with a broader enum
comprehensiveExamples.description: `const` fixes one value; adding other enum values conflicts with it.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Wrong: const value not included in enum
comprehensiveExamples.description: Using const with an enum that omits the const value is contradictory.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Right: Use only const or only enum
comprehensiveExamples.description: Either express a single value via const, or multiple via enum.

message: Remove `enum` when `const` is present, or vice-versa.
